result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael James Boho Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael James Boho in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered any cash bail remaining on this case to be transferred to case 15CM1403 and applied to costs.

Defendant Michael James Boho in court with Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  
Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

**CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 44 FOR BRANCH 40**

Matter before the Court for Final Pre-trial.  Parties have reached settlement; defendant accepts plea negotiations.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to global plea negotiations and on state's motion, the Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN  for the purpose of sentencing in case 15CM01403.

*jury trial date of 8-12-15 vacated*  Other in-court activity scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case sent to Branch 44 for plea hearing as this court is in trial.  rmm

Defendant Michael James Boho in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial.  Defendant has a new case.  Court granted defense motion to adjourn the 5/26/15 jury trial.   On motion of the state, Court ordered 15CM1229 and 15CM1403 joined for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael James Boho in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Court did not accept the Amended Complaint filed by the state.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-22-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael James Boho in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Court's own Motion, Court DISMISSED Court ONE of the criminal complaint. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.40  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
